features.name: Vendor notification email ingestion and processing

breakdown.task: Set up inbox and environment to capture emails at change.notification@cipla.com (including permissions, connection, error logging)
Research and prototype email body and attachment extraction for all major email formats (Outlook, Gmail, etc.)
Develop logic to save email metadata, content, attachments to database/storage for processing
Extract email fields and file types; read and parse various attachment formats (.docx, .pdf, .xls, .png, etc.)

features.name: Present ingested emails and attachments to CR team

breakdown.task: UI/UX research & prototyping to display email content and large multiple attachments
Develop frontend views for list/detail of ingested notifications and attachments
Handle secure download/view of attachments (all file types)
Connect backend API to frontend for listing, filtering, viewing emails+attachments
Research criteria for validity and prototype rule-based detection logic
Develop backend status assignment, branching logic, and route handling
Implement UI for CR team to view & manually update validity as needed

features.name: SharePoint integration for Not Valid/Valid status

breakdown.task: Research SharePoint API and prototype required endpoints (write, update, comments)
Implement update logic to mark Not Valid, add comment, end process
Error handling, authentication, and permission management for integration
Develop checklist forms (UI/backend) to identify change type, fields per CR checklist
Set up integration to ingest SAP data dump (ZQMR01) for Manufacturer/Supplier lookups
Map Material No. to category using SAP data; handle manual override logic
Attachment extraction/capture for emails, parse and store (if any)
UI for buyer/vendor details, implementation date, human intervention logic (manual input, fallback)
Store vendor name, buyer details, change implementation date, change details, etc.
Design and implement duplicate logic (field comparisons, fuzzy matching, DB queries)
Integrate with SharePoint: mark as Duplicate, update, terminate
Prototype and implement SOP classification logic (major/minor/moderate); read SOPs
Develop frontend/backend for document vs checklist matching workflow

features.name: SoC Request and API DMF/CEP version validation (API-only)

breakdown.task: Implement backend logic to send automated SoC email to vendor (template, triggers, logs)
Prototype logic to match/compare DMF/CEP version with SAP/internal docs and highlight diffs
Develop notification system for outstanding/missing document follow-up (emails, reminders, status tracking)
Implement logic to mark documents as collected, in process, or outstanding
Develop backend logic for completeness, validity and declaration requirement checks
Build UI for review/override by CR team as needed
Design/implement SAP extract logic for finding impacted materials, mapping to finished goods
Extract, filter, and clean impacted FG material lists (SAP ZPP_Fg_CUST), remove NA
Get existing stock details from SAP MB52/Certificate of Analysis from SAP MM03

features.name: TrackWise CR form & document package initiation

breakdown.task: Research Word document programmatic generation and zip file creation, prototype templates
Develop logic to collate all vendor-supplied documents into zip
Collate and attach all SAP/material code impact analysis extracts
Format and attach the impacted FG list (specified format); package all files for CR team review

reasons: This estimation is quite realistic. It includes explicit research/discovery steps for each major area (email formats, SharePoint, SAP integration, document generation), and nearly every feature shows proper breakdown (task-by-task), e.g., UI/UX prototyping, error handling, prototyping, and metadata extraction. Hidden complexity is acknowledged through error logging, handling various attachment types (.docx, .pdf, .xls, .png), authentication, permission management, edge case logic (manual overrides, fallback logic, duplicates/fuzzy matches, data normalization/cleanup), and integration with multiple external systems. Testing and retries are either included or implicit in breakdowns involving prototyping and logging. Time estimates for many features are realistic and similar in depth to the sample. A small deduction may apply for not always explicitly listing 'testing/debugging/documentation' for each sub-feature, but the coverage and approach indicate high real-world awareness. Realistic branching logic and document processing is present for all the hard spots. Overall, this deserves a high score.

This is a highly realistic estimate. It consistently includes research and prototyping tasks (e.g., researching email formats, prototyping rule-based detection, research on SharePoint/TrackWise document generation) before diving into development, satisfying the Discovery/Research criteria. The complexity of external systems (SAP data extracts, parsing various attachment types like .docx, .pdf, fuzzy matching for duplicate checks) is explicitly addressed in the sub-tasks. The features are well-broken down, acknowledging necessary branching logic and error logging/handling.

breakdown.task: Research & Setup: Email service/API integration (e.g., MS Graph/Exchange API, specialized ingestion service).
Implement secure email ingestion endpoint (polling or webhook setup) and process incoming emails from change.notification@cipla.com.
Parse email body, extract metadata (sender, subject, timestamp).
Implement secure attachment handling (storage, metadata extraction).
Database schema design for storing email data and attachment references.

features.name: 2. CR Team Review UI (Presentation of Ingested Content)

breakdown.task: Design & implement Email Review Dashboard/Screen layout.
API integration to fetch and display ingested email content and extracted metadata.
Implement secure attachment listing and preview/download functionality.
Basic error handling and state management for the review screen.
Design and implement Validity Check data model/API endpoint for decision capture.
Research & Setup: SharePoint API integration (authentication, list item access).
Implement 'Not Valid' workflow branch: update SharePoint item status to 'Not Valid' and add comment 'CR not required.'
Implement workflow termination logic for the 'Not Valid' path.
Implement 'Valid' path transition and state update.

features.name: 4. Initial Evaluation - SAP Data Retrieval and Mapping

breakdown.task: Research & Setup: SAP integration methods (BAPI/RFC/OData) for data extraction and environment configuration.
Develop backend services to interface with SAP to fetch and cache ZQMR01 (Manufacturer list data dump).
Implement logic to map 'Manufacturer Description' to 'Supplier code' and 'Material No.' via ZQMR01 data.
Develop service/logic to identify material category (RM/PM) by mapping 'Material No.' to category data (SAP).
Implement structured data capture for Change Type, Change Details, and Implementation Date.
Implement persistence layer for storing all initial evaluation fields and extracted codes.
Develop UI form to display extracted data (Vendor Name, Material codes/Category) and allow CR team input for mandatory fields (Change Type, Dates).
Implement dynamic UI state for handling missing material code and capturing Buyer details (Human Intervention required fields).
Implement form validation and submission API for initial evaluation data.
Define and implement duplicate check algorithm based on key extracted fields (Material No., Vendor, Change Details/Type).
Implement logic to query existing CR records (DB/SharePoint) based on duplication criteria.
Implement 'If Duplicate' branch: update SharePoint status to 'Duplicate CR' and trigger process termination.
Implement 'If Not Duplicate' transition logic.
Develop rules engine/mapping structure for classifying CRs as major/minor/moderate based on SOP criteria and initial evaluation data.
Implement logic to match required vendor documents against the CR checklist based on SOP classification.
Persist SOP classification results and the list of required documents.

features.name: 7. SoC Request and API Material Verification

breakdown.task: Implement automated email trigger logic for Statement of Change (SoC) request (API-only scenario).
Design data model/storage for Cipla registered DMF/CEP version and vendor confirmed version.
Implement comparison logic between Cipla dossier version and vendor confirmed version, highlighting discrepancies.
Implement tracking mechanism (DB/workflow state) to monitor received vs. required vendor documents.
Develop CR team UI to track document status and trigger follow-up reminders (manual/semi-automated).
Implement Document Validation logic for completeness (all documents received).
Implement Document Validation logic for validity (basic checks against checklist).
Implement Document Validation logic for required declarations.
Develop SAP API calls to identify Finished Goods (FG) usage based on impacted materials (T-codes/views).
Develop SAP API call to extract Impacted FG material list from SAP ZPP_Fg_CUST.
Implement filtering logic to remove non-used or NA items from the extracted FG list.
Develop SAP API call to retrieve existing stock details (MB52).
Develop SAP API call to retrieve Certificate of Analysis (CoA) (MM03).
Implement data structuring and storage for all SAP extracts.
Research and implement document generation library (e.g., DOCX) for creating the TrackWise Word document.
Implement synthesis logic to compile all requisite fields (from Initial Evaluation, SOP, DMF checks) into the Word template.
Implement logic to create a ZIP file containing vendor documents, SAP extracts, and the impacted FG list (specified format).
Create final API endpoint for the CR team to download the compiled package (Word + Zip).

reasons: This estimation is also highly realistic. Strong evidence of research/spiking for each integration (email API, SAP, SharePoint), environment setup, schema design, and investigations. Nearly every feature is broken down at an implementation level (model, API, UI, validation, error handling). Hidden complexities are called out: error handling, attachment preview/download, document completeness/validity, dynamic UI states for human intervention, edge-case state management, workflow branching for 'Duplicate', 'Not Valid', etc., and SharePoint workflow termination logic. The permutations of input and process branches are well-addressed with task-level separation. However, this estimate at times splits functionality into multiple lists per feature, making traceability across the entire workflow marginally more complex for a solo developer (though detail is high). There is a bit of repetition in workflow steps but nothing indicating underestimation or naiveté. Possible minor deduction for some optimistic time values at the front-end. Still, meets nearly all best practice checkpoints for estimates of this kind.

This estimation is exceptionally realistic and earns a perfect score. It meticulously addresses all three audit checks. It assigns time for research and setup for complex integrations (e.g., naming MS Graph/Exchange API, researching BAPI/RFC/OData for SAP). Hidden complexity is handled by explicitly detailing tasks like developing rules engines for SOP classification, defining duplicate check algorithms, secure attachment handling, and complex SAP T-code extracts (ZPP_Fg_CUST, MB52, MM03). The breakdown is clear, step-by-step, and reflects real-world integration challenges and human intervention requirements.
